fields.Title of Contribution: “Jokin Zaitegi: Erbestetik Euskal Komunitate Irudikatua Eraikitzen”
fields.Name of Conference: XVI Congreso Internacional. Exilio y Humanidades: las rutas de la cultura. Ochenta años después
fields.Description/Abstract: The aim of this work is to study the “imagined community” (Benedict Anderson, 1993) that Jokin Zaitegi, along with other Basque intellectuals, built in the magazine Euzko-Gogoa (Guatemala, 1950-1954 Biarritz, 1955-1960). Euzko-Gogoak allowed the Basque community (writers and readers) to build a sense of eternal "fellowship" from the concrete and unequal space that the exile recognizes. After losing the war in 1936, many Basques suffered revenge on the victors. In the face of this traumatic situation, many had to leave their homeland and go into exile. Euzko-Gogoa became a platform for the construction of an imaginary community that could be the Basque nation of the future, the lifeblood of the utopian dreams of stateless Basque. The aim of the presentation is to explain the role and influence of Basque culture, and especially the Basque language in the Basque community represented by Zaitegi in the magazine Euzko-Gogoa.
